TITLE.P: Tourism services for Trøndelag — Dialogue meetings

SHORT_DESCR.P: Trøndelag County shall procure tourism services for Trøndelag. We would, thus, like a dialogue with the market.
3 times have been put aside on 23.3.18; 0900-1030, 1100-1230. 1300-1430. Registration deadline, Wednesday 14 March at 12:00.
Registration is to be sent to: kjeby@trondelagfylke.no
Documents will be published nearer the meeting date, which the contracting authority would like feedback on.
Background:
Norwegian and international tourism is going through major changes. The changes are so radical that there is a paradigm change.

The most important change is that experiences create a “reason to go” and increase the willingness to pay. At the same time the customers are more value orientated. Experiences are individual, so deeper customer insight will therefore be a dominating competition factor. What we want to experience is now more important that where we go.

As tourism actors and joint organisations in tourism, this means that we must stop basing ourselves on the products and geography, both as regards development, marketing and sales, but rather be centered on the customer.

Branded goods are now built through relations, good customer experiences and strategic stories that are shared, as much as through what we ourselves say. This means that joint marketing is changing from us talking to the customers in our language in our separate channels, to us enabling the customers to be our marketers. The major campaigns are disappearing, we are now always on and preferably run co-marketing with others.

The customers are always online and their choices of experiences and destinations are from what they find online. Technology changes the game and opens up new possibilities for us. The development and use of new technology in marketing and in the work of collecting Big-data on customers challenges our competence in these areas.

Lastly, but not least, we envisage customers actively participating in development processes. We do not only develop our own products, but also take responsibility for general destination experiences. Customers willingly contribute and ensure that what we develop suits their needs.

Distribution and sales are also changing. Conventional distribution channels, such as traditional tour operators, are under pressure from large and well-known third party channels, specialists are taking over where generalists previously dominated. We sell our products in several channels and therefore need a conscious price strategy.
The changes described here have very different requirements to joint organisations and individual actors in tourism than previously.
Political order:

Tourism related joint assignments for Trøndelag have so far been carried out by the regional company Trøndelag Reiseliv AS. The County Executive Committee decided in a meeting on 28.11.2018, case 28/17, that the tourism services shall be organised as a public innovative procurement:
1. the Tender is organised as a public innovative procurement for the years 2018 — 2021;
2. Trøndelag County will grant 8,5 NOK for the procurement of tourism services for the period 1.7.2018 — 30.6.2019;
3. the grant will be taken over regional development resources for 2018;
4. an application is being made to get resources for equivalent procurements for the years 2019, 2020 and 2021 into the operational budget and financial plan for the respective years;
5. the implementation of the tender process and the choice of tenderer will be delegated to the county governor;
6. the initiative will be evaluated after 3 years.
